title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
florinciu left at 00:09 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
jaredMScott - (00:22): hm, no luck getting the ratings plugin to work  
jaredMScott - (00:23): I have both the JAR file and XAR file loaded up from the code in SVN, however when i make calls to the classes in the JAR, nothing get instantiated  
jaredMScott - (00:23): Wondering if there is some configuration I am missing...  
sdumitriu - (00:24): You must enable the plugin in xwiki.cfg  
jaredMScott - (00:24): ...  
jaredMScott - (00:24): oh  
jaredMScott - (00:24): well now i feel dumb  
jaredMScott - (00:24): :>  
jaredMScott - (00:39): alright, making progress. the ratings object is instantiated now  
sdumitriu - (00:39): :)

jvdrean - (10:21): Hi all, there's a problem with core trunk http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-core/5909/console  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:34): I built r28081 yesterday without issue (used -Pdev)  
vmassol - (10:37): I've just fixed it  
vmassol - (10:37): it's a cyclic dep issue  
vmassol - (10:38): we'll need to think about doing it differently in the future  
vmassol - (10:39): CalebJamesDeLisl: it's only a pb if you build using -Pintegration-tests  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:39): I see. What's up with the lists?  
vmassol - (10:39): down  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:40): I see the lists.xwiki.org is working, smtp issue?  
vmassol - (10:40): something like this  
vmassol - (10:40): some disk space issue maybe  
vmassol - (10:40): I've pinged the xwiki sas infra team  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:41): Ahh, yes. My thunderbird folder is about 1.1G already.  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:43  
gvallarelli joined #xwiki at 10:56  
gvallarelli - (10:56): Hi good morning  
lucaa left #xwiki at 10:57  
kibahop left #xwiki at 11:04  
kibahop joined #xwiki at 11:10  
nickless joined #xwiki at 11:16  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 11:16  
nickless left at 11:36 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:41  
Denis - (11:50): vmassol: Hi, could you tell me why getDocumentReferenceFromPath using references has only been introduced in 2.3, and not in 2.2, since without it, usage of special character in document name could not work properly ?  
vmassol - (11:51): Denis: Hi. I don't recall exactly but I think that's because it would have required to add non bug fixes things to the 2.2 bra,ch  
vmassol - (11:51): for ex I remember that the new script service is not in the 2..2 branch  
vmassol - (11:51): and that's why I was not able to merge some bug fixes on 2.2  
vmassol - (11:51): basically on 2.2 we're not supporting special chars  
vmassol - (11:51): same as before  
Denis - (11:53): vmassol: ok, the issue is that it does it partially, and you are able to create documents that you can never reach  
vmassol - (12:01): Denis: yes I know but I don't see any easy solution  
vmassol - (12:02): and note that the 2.2 branch is close to being closed  
vmassol - (12:02): so we shouldn't introduce anything dangerous on it at this stage  
vmassol - (12:02): and backporting lots of issue is too risky  
Denis - (12:03): agreed, what confuse me is that 2.2 branch has fixes related to special chars  
Denis - (12:04): the latest is XWIKI-5075  
Denis - (12:04): vmassol: these seems to me useless since they are unsupported in URLs  
vmassol - (12:05): Denis: I agree  
vmassol - (12:05): but it's probbaly hard to remove them  
Denis - (12:05): sure, but this could cause confusion, I suggest we add a big warning in the release note.  
florinciu left at 12:08 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
lucaa - (12:09): hi guys. We seem to be redirecting xwiki/rest/ calls  to XWikiPreferences  to xwiki/admin/  
lucaa - (12:09): is this by design?  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 12:09  
lucaa - (12:09): I think rest calls should very rarely be redirected...  
lucaa - (12:10): in general, and especially in this case where I just want to get some data from that page, not administer the wiki  
vmassol - (12:22): Denis: +1 for the warning in the release notes  
Denis - (12:22): vmassol: done  
Denis - (12:25): vmassol: also added a reminder in 2.2.4 which has many fixes related to special chars  
vmassol - (12:27): thx

jvdrean - (13:42): I'm ready to start the 2.3M2 release. AFAICS the only nice to have item that haven't been commited is lucene as default search (tmortagne), anyone knows if Thomas was planning to commit it soon ? (vmassol?)  
vmassol - (13:44): vmassol: we told me several days/weeks ago that he was very close but I don't know if he was able to work on it. Indded I'd like to have lucene by default too in 2.3 final  
vmassol - (13:44): jvdrean: could you ask thomas?  
vmassol - (13:44): (don't know where he is today)  
jvdrean - (13:47): just called him, he's off today  
jvdrean - (13:47): he can't commit what he have ftm and suggest to commit it during RC1, vmassol wdyt ?  
vmassol - (13:48): ok for me  
vmassol - (13:50): jvdrean: looking at the watchlist mail for xwiki.org there's something I don't understand in the last one  
vmassol - (13:51): it says sole pages were modified by TimBrookson but when I go to these pages I don't see that in the history  
vmassol - (13:51): any idea?  
vmassol - (13:51): oh ok I now  
vmassol - (13:51): know  
vmassol - (13:51): someone removed the revision since it was spam  
vmassol - (13:51): :)  
jvdrean - (13:51): pfeew :)  
vmassol - (13:52): sergiu did it

jvdrean - (17:56): have I missed something ? http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise23M2  
lucaa - (17:58): jvdrean: you could mention an improvement in annotations configuration, the new annotations configuration panel: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XAANNOTATIONS-2 but it's not mandatory...  
jvdrean - (17:59): lucaa: is it documented somewhere ? do you mind adding the section in the RL ?  
jvdrean - (17:59): s/RL/RN/  
lucaa - (18:00): no, it's not documented, but we should add it to the ann feature documentation...  
lucaa - (18:01): lemme build a nice print screen  
anamarias left at 18:04 (Quit: anamarias  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:05): sdumitriu: I notices the ajax saveAndContinue class never seems to be instanciated. I needed to save a bunch of things at once so I just created an object and saved using that. Is there a better way?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:05): s/notices/noticed/  
florinciu left at 18:11 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
arkub left at 18:14 (Quit: Leaving  
sdumitriu - (18:16): CalebJamesDeLisl: You mean you want to trigger a save and continue from JS?  
factor\_ left at 18:16 (Quit: Leaving  
factor joined #xwiki at 18:17  
sdumitriu - (18:17): You need to fire the save action  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:17): Yes, but I want to trigger it for a bunch of forms.  
vmassol - (18:17): jvdrean: very important warning missing in the release notes  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 18:17  
vmassol - (18:17): about standalone/inline macros  
lucaa - (18:20): vmassol: thanks for the annotations update in the RN, I was just about to do it myself  
vmassol - (18:21): lucaa: it's not me  
vmassol - (18:21): (was jvdrean I believe)  
lucaa - (18:21): ok, thanks jvdrean  
lucaa - (18:21): and thanks to all devs in general  (just to be sure)  
vmassol - (18:21): thanks to the universe!  
vmassol - (18:21): and beyond!  
lucaa - (18:22): +1  
vmassol - (18:22): (just to be sure)  
vmassol - (18:22): :)  
vmassol - (18:23): jvdrean: we need to fix the RN asap  
vmassol - (18:23): otherwise we'll get lots of complaints  
vmassol - (18:23): (we'll get them anyway but still ;))  
vmassol - (18:23): we also need to list all pages that the users MUST upgrade  
vmassol - (18:23): I think I sent the list in an email  
vmassol - (18:24): let me try to find it again  
vmassol - (18:24): ok got it  
vmassol - (18:24): will add the warnings  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:24): sdumitriu: Would you do me a favor and look at http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XAADMINISTRATION-125 I am afraid I might have introduced it meddling with the lightbox but I can't test as I don't have IE/windxws.  
jvdrean - (18:26): back, thanks vmassol for the warnings  
vmassol - (18:26): doing it  
sdumitriu - (18:28): CalebJamesDeLisl: I will  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:28): Thank you.

vmassol - (18:34): done  
vmassol - (18:34): I hope it's clear enough....  
vmassol - (18:34): I'm still worried by how much problem this will generate  
vmassol - (18:45): I wonder if we should create the 2.3 branch now in order not to introduce risks for the 2.3 release. Theoretically yes. In practice?
